,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: We stayed in cabin #3 in the Riverside Cabins and it was great! It was back away from the road and not attached to any other buildings so our stay there was very quiet. It was extremely clean! The washer and dryer were so nice to have. The kitchen has basic cooking tools and some herbs and seasonings. The beds were fairly comfortable. It was a short stay, as we were just passing through, but met the needs of the four of us quite well! It had a cute, nicely landscaped courtyard that the cabins all faced. Stayed with kids
review_text:
A beautiful house perfect for a family. Sometimes Airbnbs look like they've been thrown together by an IKEA catalogue, but this actually looked and felt like home- everything was pristine and comfortable. The yard was great for the kids to run around in. The beds were perfect- oh so comfortable. Rooms were perfect in size and comfort. Everything was perfectly clean and the neighborhood was quiet.
Everything is drive-able distance.
We also followed several of Tyler's recommendations and they did not disappoint!
Also, sometimes AirBnbs say, "thanks for staying- now do 30 million things before you leave". Tyler asked us to strip the beds, lock the doors, start a load of towels and dishes, take out the trash, and we're out. So nice not to have to do a million things before hauling our family out.
I would definitely recommend.

review_text:
Thank you, Tyler for a wonderful and comfortable stay at your house! What you see is what you get, our expectations were high based on photos shown on listing, house met all our expectations and then some! The overall vibe of the place was a home away from home! The entire house was spotlessly clean and we were able to make use of the well appointed kitchen to prepare all our meals and the dining table was a sufficient size and central to our gathering! We appreciated the open spaced layout of the house because it allowed us to talk to each other whether we were in the kitchen, the dining table or the sofa/sectional!
The bedrooms were cozy, the mattresses and pillows were so comfortable! I brought my own pillow but never brought it out of my car because the pillows in the room I slept in was the right height and feel! The bathrooms too were clean with great water pressure from the showers. If we were to return for another family reunion, we would definitely want to stay here again!

We had 5 adults, 1 child, and 1 infant and we had plenty of space. The home looked exactly like the photos depicted and was super clean upon arrival. We cooked often at the house and it had all the appliances needed.
The backyard was great. Plenty of space to throw the ball around and the fire pit was great. The location was great! Plenty of grocery stores and restaurants nearby. Easy 10pm drive to downtown to stores and restaurants! Also easy to get to other towns to go to places like the Wildlife Safari and Crater Lake.
Great price for everything you get. Definitely would recommend!

The lofted bed is not easy to get up and down on, so keep that in mind when traveling with young kiddos or older adults. The upstairs space is mostly just for kids, with two small mattresses and sleeping bags. The kids loved it!
The kitchen is great for cooking basic meals, but the space and bakeware is limited so plan ahead. The oven is a half oven too as the space is definitely tight. But they have lots of dishes and a dishwasher which was handy!
All around it was a great experience and I highly recommend if you are in southern Oregon to explore. Lots of great hiking and outdoor areas not too far!

I learned later that I was supposed to pull on a bottle opener to open the gate. Iâ€™ve never encountered a gate like that before. Iâ€™ve stayed in over 22 different airbnbs and lived and traveled around the world, but Iâ€™ve never had an issue with a gate or self-check-in. For working from the space- The Wifi supported Zoom calls without issue and the area is quiet during the day. There are plenty of outlets too.
For personal time- The outdoor area is great for lounging or dining. The location makes walking to the farmers market and most of the downtown area easy.
The hosts are wonderful. We needed to extend our stay and they were quick and kind about it.
All around a great stay!! We will book again!!

This place was so stinking cute! Perfect for the trip. I needed somewhere in town - close to the hospital. It was everything I really needed. The little kitchen area is perfect- waterfall shower is amazingly hot and the courtyard is great. The design of the studio and the fireplace is amazing for ambience- fair warning it does not actually provide heat but the hosts do also provide a heater! You do share a wall with another Airbnb (I believe?) and the guests next to me were incredibly noisy the second night-
It seriously sounded like they were wrestling and slamming into the walls. Thankfully I had earplugs and thatâ€™s really not something you can control with Airbnb so I was understanding. The bed would be my only serious comment. Not really that comfortable. For the price and the location- I really appreciated the space and the opportunity to be close to where I needed to be! A great space for a great price â¤ï¸

November 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: If you're going back and forth between this place and another....BOOK THIS ONE! This was such a warm, cozy stay for a night on my way to San Diego from northern Washington (I'm a travel nurse)....I stay in these very often and I learn what makes for a good air bnb. This one, is a good one. Probably one of the best ones I have ever stayed in. The shower was amazing, the pressure and size of the shower was perfect. The glass fireplace honestly made my stay. It changes colors, heat settings and speeds. I had some wine with this going and it was perfect after a long day of driving. The bed is very comfortable. The outside area is very spacious and cozy with the string lights and waterfall. I did have some trouble finding the place in the dark but Mason called me right away and answered my questions. A very nice keurig/coffee pot was provided as well as kcups from a local coffee shop. I really appreciated this because you would be surprised how many air bnbs don't even provide coffee or a coffee maker. 10/10 recommend this place. Thanks for allowing me to stay!

Charity was a gracious, responsive, and helpful host with an AMAZING home!!
The house is impeccable, adorable, perfect for families and pets! We will definitely go back!
The kitchen and fridge are amazing, and well-outfitted for a family!
My kids also enjoyed the game room! And the big TV!
So many beds, pillows, and blankets in airbnbs are cheap and uncomfortable but these were so nice and high-quality. We have a sensitive sleeper who travels with a mattress pad, and he didnâ€™t even need it (for the first time ever)!!
We unfortunately ended up there during fire season and the smoke made it impossible for us to do what weâ€™d planned. Charity made it easy to leave early, even though the shortened stay was in no way her fault. Also, the AC in the home made it possible for us to stay in comfort and clean air! ğŸ™
There were wifi issues the first day, and Charity not only helped me troubleshoot, but she called the service provider, and the issues were resolved for the rest of our stay.
